statement.p: Let X,Y,Z be finite sets, perhaps of different cardinalities. Let f:X \rightarrow Y and g:Y \rightarrow Z.

Decide whether each of the following statements is true or false.
If the statement is true, provide a proof. (Pro tip: It might be easier to prove the contrapositive.)
If the statement is false, provide a counterexample.
Here are the statements:
If g \circ f is injective then f is injective.
If g \circ f is injective then g is injective.
If g \circ f is surjective then f is surjective.
If g \circ f is surjective then g is surjective.
